headline: CNN 10
subHeadline: Top U.N. Court Orders Israel to Prevent Genocide in Gaza But Stops Short of Ordering Ceasefire; Michigan Native Goes Viral on TikTok Sharing Journey in Antarctica During Research Trip; A Journey to Explore the Ocean`s Twilight Zone. Aired 4-4:10a ET

utterances.speaker: BENJAMIN NETANYAHU, ISRAELI PRIME MINISTER
utterances.sentences: Like every country, Israel has an inherent right to defend itself. The violent attempt to deny Israel thisfundamental right is blatant discrimination against the Jewish State. And it was justly rejected. The charge of genocide level against Israel is not only false, it`s outrageous. And decent people everywhere should reject it. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Pop quiz, hot shot.What percentage of the Earth`s surface is covered with water? 50%, 62%, 71%, or 96%? If you said, 71%, put your hands up. That`s according to U.S. Geological Survey. All right, being up here in Detroit, Michigan, we`re nestled between two of the great lakes, lake Huron and Lake Michigan, both of which become frozen, this time of year, at least parts of them. Well, for our next story, we head to Antarctica where a man from here in Michigan is going viral on TikTok as he`s sharing his research journey, searching for the oldest ice on the planet all while battling some exceed cold conditions. He spoke to our affiliate WXYZ from Sydney, Australia after completing his third trip near the South Pole. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: AUSTIN CARTER, ICE CORE RESEARCHER
utterances.sentences: So, what is the difference between ice you make at home in your freezer and ice here in Antarctica? The answer tothat is bubbles. ALICIA SMITH, WXYZ ANCHOR (voice-over): If Austin Carter had to pick a theme song, it would probably be "Ice Ice Baby." The 27-year-old doctoral student and Royal Oak native has been living on the southernmost continent for 50 days where researchers are drilling for ice.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: So, ice cores from Antarctica are this unique scientific resource. They contain a record of earth`s climate that`s pretty much unrivaled byother archives.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: I caught up with him in Sydney, Australia via ZOOM this week after he`d just wrapped up his third trip near the South Pole.He joined researchers from 15 universities and COLDEX to find the oldest ice on the planet and study the prehistoric dust particles trapped inside. (On camera): What is the oldest core of ice you`ve uncovered?

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: Our oldest ice sample that we`ve collected now is greater than 4 million years old and this is the oldest ice that`s ever been collected onthe planet.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: And he`s been serving up this polar science knowledge to the masses.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: Here are five things we can and cannot do while living here in Antarctica.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: This video racked has up 27.5 million views on TikTok.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: My mother actually encouraged me to do, you know, she was like, "You know, people really have a lot of questions. You should make aneducational video." (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: In our next story, we want to take you on a journey to explore the ocean`s Twilight Zone. This home to ecosystems has rarely been explored ordocumented by science, but husband and wife divers, Emmanuelle and Ghislain Bardout made it their mission. Our Bill Weir caught up with the team as they were preparing for a six-month long expedition in the Mediterranean. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) GHISLAIN BARDOUT, CO-FOUNDER & CO-DIRECTOR, UNDER THE POLE: When you are a diver, you are always curious to go to see a little bit further. I think every single diver in the world, when you are about to go up, you always have an eye to the depth, to the bottom. Little by little, you want to go deeper because you wonder what, what are you going to find?

utterances.speaker: BILL WEIR, CNN CHIEF CLIMATE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Ghislain Bardout with his wife Emmanuelle in 2007, he has conducted thousands of dives often to 150 oreven 200 meters deep. His crew has explored everywhere from the Arctic to the Canary Islands, French Polynesia to the Caribbean.

utterances.speaker: BARDOUT
utterances.sentences: We are talking about new ecosystem that`s covered the entire planet. All the shore, everywhere. It`s just below 30 meters, 40 meters.And there are, for sure, many species, many different ecosystem that all have a huge importance. So acquiring a better understanding of their ecology is essential for the conservation of those depths.

utterances.speaker: WEIR
utterances.sentences: With scientists aboard their boat under the poll aims to document these ecosystems for the first time and help preserve their future.Ghislain`s team are preparing for a six-month expedition, in the Mediterranean. That will take them from Greece to Italy, to France. In 2022, under the Pole help gain protection for black coral force in the Canary Islands. And they believe there is a similar ecosystem to be explored on their Mediterranean voyage next year.

utterances.speaker: BARDOUT
utterances.sentences: In Greece, they already explored the depths with robots ROVs. So they know some fields of black corals, but are not able to study because ofthe depths, because they do not have the divers to do so. And I like those missions where there`s huge collaborations, you know, with different people that can do together something they cannot do alone or just with their own team. (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: For today`s story getting that 10 out of 10, how many chicken nuggets can you chow down? A California family fit off way more than they couldchew when they ordered food for delivery are magnificent. Jeanne Moos serves up a major Mickey bees mishap. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: JEANNE MOOS, CNN NATIONAL NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: They thought they`d ordered several burgers, some fries and a few chicken McNuggets.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: This is a prank. It has to be a prank.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Instead they got inundated with McNuggets. So many that grandma couldn`t count.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Without bursting into laughter, her son-in-law put his head on the counter.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS MULLANCE, PLACE THE ORDER
utterances.sentences: There was nuggets and nuggets and nugget - -

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Delivered from a McDonald`s in Long Beach, California by a door dash driver.

utterances.speaker: MULLANCE
utterances.sentences: Guy said this was the biggest order he`s ever had.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: And they didn`t skimp on the sauce. Jessica Vaccaro, then four-year- old son had questions.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That`s a lot?

utterances.speaker: JESSICA VACCARO, RECORDER VIDEO
utterances.sentences: Mommy, is that a lot? Grandma, is this funny?

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Jessica, we recently unearth this 2017 video. She posted it, it went viral. They ended up giving most of the McNuggets to the homeless.

utterances.speaker: VACCARO
utterances.sentences: You packed them all up. And we went down to the beach and we handed them out.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Her husband, Chris thinks he accidentally added a zero ordering 20, rather than just 2, 10-piece boxes. He admits, he barely looked at thetotal bill and he dropped this nugget.

utterances.speaker: MULLANCE
utterances.sentences: I consider myself a bit of a chicken McNuggets kind of sewer.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: But 200, give us a "McBreak."(END VIDEOTAPE)
